key_points: QAnon conspiracy theorists speculated about the reasons behind a major Facebook outage.
Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp experienced a six-hour outage, affecting billions of users.
The outage led to a roughly 4.9 percent decrease in Facebook's stock value, erasing about $40 billion from its market cap.
Facebook attributed the outage to internal system issues and assured no user data was compromised.
QAnon followers theorized the outage might be the predicted 'Blackout' signaling mass arrests of global elites.
John Sabal (QAnon John) highlighted a 4Chan post hinting at a coming global internet outage.
Newsweek reported the 4Chan post appeared minutes after the Facebook platforms went offline.
Ron Watkins suggested the outage could be linked to Facebook's reaction to whistleblower Frances Haugen's allegations.
QAnon John and Ron Watkins, who have substantial Telegram followings, plan to attend the 'For God and Country: Patriot Double Down' convention.
The convention is expected to host QAnon followers and Republican politicians who dispute the 2020 Presidential Election results.
